content: Yes, some species of pine trees can live for hundreds or even thousands of years, particularly those that grow in extreme climates or isolated environments. For example, the Great Basin Bristlecone Pine, which is found in the western United States, can live for more than 5,000 years. However, most pine trees that are grown for commercial purposes are harvested well before reaching their maximum lifespan, typically between 20-60 years depending on the intended use.
